entry.title: Set Theory
entry.content:
Set

notations

  • relashionship of set
    • $A\subseteq B\iff orall x(x\in A o x\in B)$
    • $A=B\iff orall x(x\in A\leftrightarrow x\in B)$
  • operations of set
    • $A\cap B={ x|x\in A \wedge x\in B}$
    • $A\cup B={ x|x\in A \vee x\in B}$
    • $A\setminus B={x|x\in A\wedge x otin B}$
    • $A^c={x|x otin A}$
    • $A\Delta B=(A\cup B)\setminus(A\cap B)$
    • $ igcap_{i\in I}A_i={x| orall i\in I,x\in A_i}$
    • $ igcup_{i\in I}A_i={x|\exists i\in I,x\in A_i}$

limit of set

a sequence of set ${A_n}{n=1}^\infty$
if $A_n\subset A{n+1}$, we says it is monotone increasing
and denote $ igcup_{n=1}^\infty A_n$ as $\lim_{n o\infty}A_n$
if $A_n\supset A_{n+1}$, we says it is monotone decreasing
and denote $ igcap_{n=1}^\infty A_n$ as $\lim_{n o\infty}A_n$

${ igcap_{k=n}^\infty A_k}{n=1}^\infty$ is monotone increasing
$$\lim\inf{n o\infty} A_n= igcup_{n=1}^\infty igcap_{k=n}^\infty A_k$$
$x\in\lim\inf_{n o\infty}A_n\iff\exists n, orall k\geq n,(x\in A_k)$
${ igcap_{k=n}^\infty A_k}{n=1}^\infty$ is monotone decreasing
$$\lim\sup{n o\infty} A_n= igcap_{n=1}^\infty igcup_{k=n}^\infty A_k$$
$x\in\lim\sup_{n o\infty}A_n\iff orall n,\exists k\geq n,(x\in A_k)$

n-tuple: $$(x_1,x_2,\cdots,x_n)={x_1,{x_1,x_2},{x_1,x_2,x_3},\cdots}$$
Cartesian product
$$A imes B={(a,b)|a\in A \wedge b\in B}$$
specifically, $A^4=A imes A imes A imes A$

Power set
the power set of $S$, denoted as $\mathscr{P}(S)$, such that
$$X\in\mathscr{P}(S)\iff X\subseteq S$$

Partition
$\mathscr{A}$ is a partition of nonempty set $X$ if

  • $ orall A\in\mathscr{A},(A eq\emptyset)$
  • $ igcup_{A\in\mathscr{A}}A=X$
  • $ orall A_1,A_2\in X,(A\cap B eq\emptyset o A_1=A_2)$

mapping

$f$ is a mapping from $X$ to $Y$, denoted as $f:X o Y$,if

  • $ orall x\in X,\exists y\in Y,\Big((x,y)\in f\Big)$
  • $ orall x\in X, orall y_1,y_2\in Y,\Big((x,y_1)\in f\wedge(x,y_2)\in f o y_1=y_2\Big)$

$f$ is a correspondence rule between two nonempty set $X,Y$ and each $x\in X$ map to a unique $y\in Y$, then $f$ is a mapping from $X$ to $Y$ denoted as $f:X o Y$

  • domain: $D=X$
  • codomain: $Y$
  • range: $R={y|y=f(x),x\in D}$
  • If $x$ is an element of $X$, and $f(x)=y$, then $x$ is preimage of $y$, $y$ is image of $x$, denoted as $x\mapsto y$

bijection & injection & surjection

  • injection/one to one: $ orall x_1,x_2\in X,(f(x_1)=f(x_2) o x_1=x_2)$

  • surjection/onto: $ orall y\in Y,\exists x \in X,(f(x)=y)$

  • bijection: $ orall x_1,x_2\in X,(f(x_1)=f(x_2) o x_1=x_2)\wedge orall y\in Y,\exists x \in X,(f(x)=y)$

  • function

    • a mapping from number set to number set

  • functional

    • a mapping from function set to number set

  • operator

    • a mapping from function set to function set

  • identity function

    • $i_X:X o X$ defined by $i_X(x)=x$

  • composition

    • $f:A o B,g:B o C$, then $g\circ f(x)=g(f(x))$
    • $h\circ (g\circ f)=(h\circ g)\circ f$

  • inverse

    • let $f:X o Y$ a bijection, $f(x)=y\iff f^{-1}(y)=x$
    • $f^{-1}\circ f=i_X$ and $f\circ f^{-1}=i_Y$
    • $(f\circ g)^{-1}=g^{-1}\circ f^{-1}$

  • image of $A\subseteq X$

    • $f(A)={f(x)|x\in A}$

  • inverse images of $B\subseteq Y$

    • $f^{-1}(B)={y|f(y)\in B}$

  • transformation $f:X o X$

    • permutation $T$ is a transformation and a bijetion
    • identity map $I:X o X, orall x\in X,(I(x)=x)$

indicator function
suppose $S\subseteq X$, then $\chi_S:X o{0,1}$ defined by $\chi_S(x)=0$ if $x otin S$, and $\chi_S(x)=1$ if $x\in S$

Relation

if $R\subseteq X^n$, it is called n-ary relation
more often, we discuss binary relation

suppose $R$ is a binary relation on $X$, it has the following properties conditionally

  • reflexive property
    • $ orall x\in X((x,x)\in R)$
  • symetric property
    • $(x_1,x_2)\in R o(x_2,x_1)\in R$
  • antisymetric property
    • $(x_1,x_2)\in R\wedge (x_2,x_1)\in R o x_1=x_2$
  • strongly antisymetric property
    • $(x_1,x_2)\in R o(x_2,x_1) ot\in R$
  • transitive property
    • $(x_1,x_2\in R\wedge(x_2,x_3)\in R o(x_1,x_3)\in R)$
    • EXAMPLE1:”greater than” relation on the set of real numbers is transitive
    • 传递闭包(transitive closure)
      • The transitive closure of $R$, denoted by $R^*$,is defined as $R^*=R igcup{(x_i,x_j)|\exists x_{k_1}\cdots x_{k_t}((x_i,x_{k_1}),(x_{k_1},x_{k_2}),\cdots,(x_{k_t},x_j)\in R)}$
      • 其实$R^*$就是包含$R$的具有传递性的最小集合
      • Warshall Algorithm 寻找传递闭包的算法
        • n次循环{找到(a,i)(i,b),add $A imes B$}

$R$ is an equivalence relation if and only if it is:

  • reflexive
  • symetric
  • transitive
    when $R$ is an equivalence relation set, we write $(x,y)\in R$ as $x\sim y$, we also define $E_x={y\in X:x\sim y}$, called equivalence class

order

preorder

for a given $(X,R)$, $X$ is a ==preordered set==, a.k.a. quasi-order set, when $R$ is:

  • irreflexive ? reflexive
  • transitive

partial order

for a given $(X,R)$, $X$ is a ==partially ordered set==, when $R$ is:

  • reflexive
  • antisymetric
  • transitive

we write $(x,y)\in R$ as $x\preceq y$, called $x$ precede $y$
if $x\preceq y \wedge x eq y$, they we write it as $x\prec y$, called $x$ strictly precede $y$

==comparability==
suppose $x_1,x_2\in X$ and $X$ is a partially ordered set, then if $x_1\preceq x_2\vee x_2\preceq x_1$, we says they are comparable, otherwice, they are uncomparable and written as $x_1||x_2$
trichotomy of relations:
$$x_1\preceq x_2\vee x_2\preceq x_1\vee x_1||x_2$$

given a partial order set $(X,\preceq)$ and a set $S\subseteq X$

  • lower bound & upper bound:
    • if $\exists m\in X, orall x\in S,(m\preceq x)$, then $m$ is a lower bound of $S$
  • infimum & supremum:
    • if $l$ is a lower bound of $S$, and $ orall m,(m\preceq l)$, then $l$ is an infimum of $S$
    • $l$ is denoted as $\inf S$
  • minimal & maximal:
    • if $\exists m\in S, orall x\in S,(m preceq x)$ , then $m$ is a minimal of $S$
  • minimum & maximum:
    • if $\exists m\in S, orall x\in S,(m\preceq x)$ then $m$ is a minimum of $S$

==Hasse diagram==
we say $x$ is a immediate predcessor of $y$ if and only if
$$(x\prec y)\wedge( eg\exists z\in X,(x\prec z\wedge z\prec y))$$
we denote it as $x\ll y$

then, we draw a line between two elements if and only if one is an immediate predcessor of the other, this is called Hasse diagram
![[Pasted image 20231108153940.png|250]]

totally ordered set

a partially ordered set $X$ is a ==totally ordered set==, a.k.a. chain or linear order, when:
$$ orall x,y\in X,(x\preceq y\vee y\preceq x\vee x=y)$$
$A$ is a ==well-ordered set==, when:
$$ orall S\subset X,S eq\emptyset, ig(\exists x\in S, orall y\in S,(x=y\vee xRy) ig)$$

lattice

==two equivalent definitions of lattice==
$\vee,\wedge:L^2 o L$ are both operator on $L$
$(L,\vee,\wedge)$ is a lattice, if and only if the both operators suffices:

  • commutitive law
  • associative law
  • absorption law: $x\wedge(x\vee y)=x$

we can deduce idempotent law then: $x\wedge x=x$

principle of duality?

$(L,\preceq)$ is a lattice, if and only if each two elements have a supremum and a infremum
suppose $x\wedge y=x o x\preceq y$, then $(L,\preceq)$ is partially ordered

$x\wedge y=\inf(x,y)$
$x\vee y=\sup(x,y)$

a lattice have a lower bound $0$ and an upper bound $I$

==distributive lattice==
a distributive lattice satisfies:

  • distributive law: $x\wedge (y\vee z)=(x\wedge y)\vee(x\wedge z)$

a totally ordered set is a lattice

==join irreducible elements==
$x$ is a join irreducible element(既约并元) if and only of $x=0$ or $(x=y_1\vee y_2) o (a=x)\vee (a=y)$
$x$ is called an atom if and only if it immediately succeed $0$
$x=d_1\vee d_2\vee\cdots\vee d_n$

==complement==
$y$ is called the complement of $x$ if:

  • $x\vee y=I$
  • $x\wedge y=0$
    complement is unique if exists

a lattice is complemented if all elements in it has a complement

==some examples of lattice==

  • $(\mathbb{Z}^+,\mid)$ or $(\mathbb{Z}^+,\gcd,\mathrm{lcm})$
  • $(\mathcal{P}(S),\subseteq)$ or $(\mathcal{P}(S),\cup,\cap)$

Order isomorphic

we says $X_1$ is order isomorphic to $X_2$ , written as $X_1\cong X_2$, if there exists a bijection $f:X_1 o X_2$ satisfies:$$x\preceq y o f(x)\preceq f(y)\wedge x||y o f(x)||f(y)$$

Cardinal

the Cardinality of set $A$, denoted as $|A|$
we says $A$ and $B$ are equivalent (or equinumerous) if and only if there exists a bijection $f:A o B$

  • $f_{bi}:A o B\iff \lvert A vert=\lvert B vert$
  • $f_{in}:A o B\iff\lvert A vert\leq\lvert B vert$
  • $f_{sur}:A o B\iff\lvert A vert\geq\lvert B vert$

$A$ is a finite set if and only if $\exists n\in\mathbb{N},(|{1,2,\cdots,n}|=|A|)$
otherwise, it is is a infinite set

$A$ is a countable set if and only if $\exists S\subseteq\mathbb{N},(|S|=|A|)$
otherwise, $A$ is a uncountable set

==Cantor-Bernstein Theorem==(康托-伯恩斯坦定理)
$$\lvert A vert\leq\lvert B vert\wedge\lvert B vert\leq\lvert A vert\iff\lvert A vert=\lvert B vert$$
Proof:
use Banach Theorem:
suppose $f:A o B, g:B o A$, $\exists A_0,A_1,B_0,B_1(B_1={f(x)|x\in A_0}\wedge A_1={g(x)|x\in B_0}$
let $f,g$ are both injection, we have$f_{bi}:A_0 o B_1 g_{bi}:B_0 o A_1$

==Cantor Theorem==
$$\lvert S vert\lt\lvert 2^S vert$$
Proof:
it suffices to prove that there isn’t an injection $f:S o 2^S$
$Z={x\in S\wedge x ot\in f(x)}$
such technique is called Cantor’s Diagonalization(康托对角线)
it is requently used when we intend to prove a set $S$ is uncountable
sppose $S$ is countable, then we can put all its elements $a,b,\cdots$ in a line, then we find a way to turn them into a sequence $a_1,a_2,\cdots,b_1,b_2,\cdots$, and we know that an element $z$, such that $z_1 eq a_1,z_2 eq b_2,\cdots$ is absent from the line

$\lvert\mathbb{N} vert\leq\lvert\mathbb{R} vert$
$\lvert[a,b] vert=\mathbb{R}$
先构造一个线性映射$f:[a,b] o[-\cfrac\pi2,\cfrac\pi2],f(x)=-\cfrac\pi2\cdot\cfrac{b+a}{b-a}$
$f$ is a bijection, $g(x)= an x$
$\lvert\mathbb{R}^\infty vert=\lvert\mathbb{R} vert$
$\lvert2^{\mathbb{N}} vert=\lvert\mathbb{R} vert$

ordinals

Ordinals belike:
$$\Phi,{\Phi},{\Phi,{\Phi}},{\Phi,{\Phi},{\Phi,{\Phi}}},\cdots$$
Properties of ordinals:
$ eta\subset\alpha\leftrightarrow eta\in\alpha$
$S(\alpha)=\alpha\cup{\alpha}$
We use ordinals as a representation element of Isomorphism class of well-ordered sets.
Construct a bijection between ordinals and natural number: $f:\omega o\mathbb{N}$
$$f(\Phi)=0,f(n+1)=f(n)\cup{f(n)}$$

==Ordinal Arithmetic==
limit ordinal: $\geq\omega$

$SUCC(\alpha)=\alpha\cup{\alpha}$
denoted as $\alpha+1$
$1+\omega=2 imes\omega=\omega$
$\omega+\omega=\omega imes2$
$\omega imes\omega=\omega^2$
$\omega^{\epsilon_0}=\epsilon_0$

$A+B$
$A imes B$
$A^B$

commutative no
associative yes

Hilbert’s room
$\epsilon_0=\omega^{\omega^{\omega^\omega}}$

cardinal
cardinality
Arithmetic
$\aleph_0$
$2^{\aleph_0}$

konig
$\sum<\prod$

transfinite

AC & Well-ordering Thm & Mathmatical induction

ZFC: Zermelo-Fraenkel Axioms with Choice
ZF: Zermelo-Fraenkel Axioms
==Axioms with Choice==
$ orall A_i,A_j\in\mathcal{S}(A_i eq A_j o A_i\cap A_j=\Phi)$, there exists a choice function $f:\mathcal{S} o A$

==Zorn’s Lemma==

==Principle of mathmatical induction==

  • first form
    • $A$ is a subset of $\mathbb{N}$ with:
    • $1\in A$
    • $k\in A o k+1\in A$
  • second form
    • $A$ is a subset of $\mathbb{N}$ with:
    • $1\in A$
    • $ igwedge_{j\in{1,2,\cdots,k}} j\in A o k+1\in A$
  • principle of transfinite induction
    • $A$ is a subset of well-ordered set $S$ with:
    • $a_0\in A$
    • $a\subseteq A o a\in A$

Russel Paradox

Russell Paradox
$S={x|x ot\in x} o((S\in S o S ot\in S)\wedge(S ot\in S o S\in S))$
Similar Paradoxes

  • Liar Paradox
  • Barber’s Paradox
  • Unexpected Hanging Paradox

类(class):

  • 真类(proper class)
    • 真类不能作为类的元素
  • 集合(set)
    • $S$是一个集合，必须满足$\exists x\in S(x\cap S=\phi)$

计数

加法法则
乘法法则

The Pigeonhole Principle

technique
找鸽子和巢(pigeion & hole),鸽子往往是最具象的,巢是抽象的,同巢的鸽子代表了必然存在的某种共性联系,这种联系可以发展成为某个更加抽象的结论

example

  • assertion:任意$n+1$个数必有两个数模$n$同余
    • pigeion:$n+1$个数
    • hole:$n$个同余类
    • 1 1 1 1 1…2
  • assertion:平面(plane)上任意5个格点(lattice point)必有2点连线中点为格点
    • pigeion:格点
    • hole:奇数偶数排列
    • 1 1 1 2
  • assertion:任意$n^2+1$元素序列,必然存在一个$n+1$元素单调子序列(monotone subsequence)
    • pigeion:元素
    • hole:不同起始增减子序列元素个数
    • 1 1 1 1 1…2

康托集(Cantor)

  • 考虑$f:Z o N$,不难构造出一个双射(bijection)
    • the same size
  • 考虑$f:A o2^A$,其中$2^A$表示$A$的所有子集的集合
    • 我们希望证明$f$不是满射
      • $B={x\in A\wedge x ot\in f(x)}$(i.e.所有不属于自己的像的元素构成的集合)那么不难证明,没有元素的像是$B$
    • 超限数(transfinite cardinals)

entry.title: Hello World
entry.content:
Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.

More info: Writing
